alert.note: Alert for Lewis (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 01 at 10:52PM PST until March 02 at 12:15PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skookumchuck River Near Bucoda affecting Thurston County. Newaukum River Near Chehalis affecting Lewis County. .Hydrologically significant rain came to an end Tuesday. Rain in the next couple of days will not result in any changes to the river levels. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Newaukum River Near Chehalis. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 202.5 feet, flood waters will inundate many roads and residential and commercial areas along the Newaukum River and its forks. Flooding in some areas may be deep and hazardous especially near rivers. Impacted roadways and surrounding areas include Jackson Hwy. and Tune, Rush, Sommerville, Griel, Hamilton, Tauscher, Guerrier, Kirkland, Macomber, Rice, Senn, Lucas Creek, Middle Fork and North Fork Roads. A stage of 202.5 feet on the Newaukum roughly corresponds to Phase 2 flood in the Lewis County flood system. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 PM PST Tuesday the stage was 203.6 feet. - The river crested around 204.9 feet at 9 am Tuesday. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue to recede the remainder of the day. - Flood stage is 202.5 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground. Stay tuned to further developments by listening to your local radio, television, or NOAA Weather Radio for further information. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by Wednesday morning at 700 AM PST.
